title: Augusta: John P. Lightner to Kate Armentrout, June 29, 1861
summary: Lightner sends Kate a description of camp life and especially the religious activities available in camp. He also writes that, although he generally hates war, he believes that the Confederate cause is just, but still hopes that peace will ultimately prevail.
keywords: Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Death/Casualties, Home Front, National Government, Patriotism, Women, American Civil War
